WRITING.TEXT: I didn; t know that red weighed more than green

I've (somewhat) been waiting to post this.
My fourth-grade teacher made a kid with a broken arm handwrite a long assignment like the rest of us. Typically she'd allow him to use one of the computers in the classroom until his arm healed up (he was right-handed; his right arm was broken).
She gave him the command after she'd finished yelling at us and slamming a textbook down. "No! You'll write it like the rest of them."
Small random gesture of recognition or kindness from a stranger whenever you feel like you're at the end of your rope.
Oh, it's you again. I saw a notification and got excited because I thought it was on a conversation about Wheel of Time in another thread.

WRITING.TITLE: Has anyone seen Legion on FX? Asking because a few episodes reminded me of Wheel of Time.
WRITING.TEXT:
Episode five specifically, and afterwards when David:
[Spoiler](/s Begins realizing his powers and becomes more of a mad god.)
Got a huge Rand vibe from a few of the David scenes later on.

Again: If she knew you were being compassionate out of pity, she would give you the same response.
Keep flailing around because someone is challenging your shallow worldview. I know that you want to believe you're thinking about this deeply possibly because you aren't capable of anything otherwise, I don't know but you're not.

And why would I explain this to her?
Physically unattractive and mentally unattractive = I will still be nice because she has a real uphill climb in life.
So you're being fake nice. Real stand-up guy. Gotcha.
Are you socially inept?
Look in the mirror and ask yourself that if you think this is truly the thought process of a grown man. No one needs your pity over the flaws you perceive in them.
